block.p: Sarah Dodd Stauderman and Andrew Osborn Robb, both museum conservators in Washington, were married there yesterday. The Rev. Wanda McNeill officiated at the Lutheran Church of the Reformation. The Rev. Dr. Albert P. Stauderman, who is the bride's grandfather and a Lutheran minister, took part in the service.

Ms. Stauderman, 36, is keeping her name. She is the preservation manager and the conservator for the Smithsonian Institution Archives. Mr. Robb, 35, is the senior conservator of photographs at the Library of Congress.

Sarah Dodd Stauderman and Andrew Osborn Robb, both museum conservators in Washington, were married there yesterday. The Rev. Wanda McNeill officiated at the Lutheran Church of the Reformation. The Rev. Dr. Albert P. Stauderman, who is the bride's grandfather and a Lutheran minister, took part in the service.

Ms. Stauderman, 36, is keeping her name. She is the preservation manager and the conservator for the Smithsonian Institution Archives. Mr. Robb, 35, is the senior conservator of photographs at the Library of Congress.

The bride graduated from Amherst College and received a master's degree in art conservation from the State University College at Buffalo. She is a daughter of Helen Stauderman and Albert P. Stauderman Jr. of Wilton, Conn. Her father is the president of Bird Bonette Stauderman, advertising production consultants in Westport, Conn. Her mother is the director of the Mark Twain Public Library in Redding, Conn.

The bridegroom is also the chairman of the photographic materials group of the American Institute for Conservation, a professional organization in Washington. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received a master's degree in art conservation from the Winterthur program at the University of Delaware. He is a son of Frances and David Robb of Huntsville, Ala. His mother, an art historian and lecturer on Southern photographers, and his father, a former director of the Huntsville Museum of Art, are museum consultants.
